title: [$150] Use `X` icon for closing the Concierge RHP instead of chevron

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Slack Thread Context: https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C090U774ZH7/p1767385544707019?thread_ts=1767385544.707019&cid=C090U774ZH7 **What the problem is:** The Concierge right-hand panel (RHP) currently displays a left-facing chevron/back-arrow as the close control. The thread concluded this is unintuitive because the Concierge panel is an open/close panel (not a navigation hierarchy), so a back-arrow suggests navigation rather than a simple close action. **What the expected output is:** The Concierge RHP should present an 'X' close control on desktop to clearly indicate open/close behavior. Other RHPs that represent hierarchical navigation should retain the back-arrow/chevron. **Debugging info:** - Observed current state: other RHPs use a left-facing chevron; Concierge also uses a chevron. - Team consensus in thread: Concierge is not navigational and should use an 'X' instead of a chevron. - No PRs, logs, or additional technical artifacts were referenced in the discussion. **Solution:** - Replace the left-facing chevron/back-arrow with an 'X' icon for the Concierge RHP Created with the :create-gh-issue: automation Screenshot:

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.93-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2662/folder/13176922/41237509/1106546191 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+2250@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 (Hybrid app) **App Component:** Search ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Account has at least one workspace. 1. Open the Expensify app. 2. Open any workspace chat, 3. Create a manual expense. 4. Navigate to "Reports" > "Expenses" 5. Tap on "Filters" 6. Tap on "Group By" > "From" and save the selection. 7. Tap on "View Results" 8. Expand the results displayed and open the just created expense. 9. Wait for the report to finish loading and return to "Expenses" 10. Note that a RBR is now visible on the "Inbox" tab. 11. Navigate to "Inbox" 12. Note that RBR is visible on preview of expense report. 13. Open the report. 14. Note that an "Unexpected error creating this chat" message is visible on report. 15. Dismiss the error message. 16. Navigate to workspace chat and return to "Inbox" again. 17. Note that RBR disappears after this last action. ## Expected Result: No error should be triggered when opening an expense from the results after applying the "Group By" filter. ## Actual Result: RBR and an "Unexpected error" message, appear when opening an expense after applying the "Group By" filter. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3d294923-1c3d-46fb-a8f7-b3048d779e1c [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to self DM. 3. Create an expense. 4. Go to workspace chat. 5. Create an expense. 6. Open expense report in workspace chat. 7. Click More > Merge. 8. Select self DM expense > Continue. 9. Select all the details from self DM expense (second option in each section) > Next. 10. Click Merge expenses. ## Expected Result: After merging with self DM expense, app will open the destination report. ## Actual Result: After merging with self DM expense, app returns to workspace chat instead of destination report. If we merge self DM expense with workspace expense and select workspace report, app will open workspace report as expected. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/170b2c5e-5ab0-43e4-a6fc-7198484b5c08 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] [Unreported] Create per diem expenses in selfDM

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
# Part of the **Support the unreported expense flow in NewDot** project Main issue: https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/495162 Doc section: Project: https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/495162 # Feature Description This enables moving the unreported Per diem expenses from selfDM to a report # Manual Test Steps The following scenarios will be tested: ### No workspace has per diems enabled 1. Have an account with no workspace with per diems enabled 2. Verify that you can't create a per diem expense in selfDM ### Only one workspace has per diems enabled 1. Have an account that has one workspace with per diems enabled 2. Verify that you can create a per diem expense in selfDM 3. Verify that you don't have to pick a workspace; the one with per diems enabled is automatically taken into consideration (exactly how it works from Global Create) ### Multiple workspaces with per diems enabled 1. Have an account that has multiple workspaces with per diems enabled 2. Verify that you can create a per diem expense in selfDM 3. Verify that you first have to pick a workspace (similar to how it works from Global Create) # Automated Tests NOTE: We have a [draft PR](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/78109) open by @koko57 who's ooo right now. Here's its status:
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @

title: [$250] Add Expensify Travel to the "What features are you interested in" page alongside other workspace toggles

labels.name: Reviewing
labels.description: Has a PR in review

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Weekly
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: AutoAssignerNewDotQuality
labels.description: Used to assign quality issues to engineers

body:
Parent issue: https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/70187 We already added a Travel feature card on the Workspace More Features page to enable Travel per workspace. Now we want to add Expensify Travel to the "What features are you interested in" page alongside other workspace toggles. To achieve that we need: 1. BE update `CreateWorkspace` API to accept `isTravelEnabled: boolean` in `features`. @fedirjh could you please take a look since you worked on this feature before? 2. FE add Travel option to the "What features are you interested in" page.

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.91-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2633/folder/13176706/41236851/1103228308 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+020101abc@applause.expensifail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Regression TC Execution **Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome **App Component:** Workspace Settings ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Assign a company card to any workspace member. - Workspace is connected to QBO. 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace settings > Members. 3. Click on the member with company card. 4. Click on the card. 5. Click QuickBooks Online credit card export. 6. Select any option. 7. Click RHP back button on card details page. 8. Click RHP back button again. ## Expected Result: In Step 7, RHP will return to member profile. ## Actual Result: In Step 7, RHP reopens card details page. In Step 8, RHP returns to member profile. Similar issue was fixed previously - https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/62197 ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/221749c4-c07d-47a2-b9e7-622c157d0f2c [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.91-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2626/folder/13176670/41237100/1103226470 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ndk.2303+new170@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Critical User Impact **Device used:** Windows 11 Home/Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Log in as the Admin of the workspace - If the admin does not have 2 workspaces, create another workspace - Navigate to a 1:1 conversation with any other user - Submit 2 Expenses to the other user to create an IOU report 1. Open https://staging.new.expensify.com/ 2. Navigate to the IOU Report details 3. Click on More 4. Click on "Change Workspace" 5. Select any workspace ## Expected Result: Report Title is updated ## Actual Result: Report title is shown as formula ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e7ae3caa-2041-4ead-9a97-0009e42acc19 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
